review.name: odd height weird feeling even

review.reviewBody: These shoes are great for all around wearing. Took them on vacation for the first wear and they performed better than any shoe I have ever worn. I have planter fasciitis and I was able to were these without my inserts. I will be buying more of these.
review.name: Best shoe ever

review.reviewBody: These shoes do not fit very well, they are incredibly narrow and uncomfortable
review.name: Too narrow for my taste

review.reviewBody: Great looking shoe , no break in needed ! great colors, Very Comfortable
review.name: Amazing Walking Shoe

review.reviewBody: Wore 2 times both times my. Hip hurt after wearing. I don’t think there’s anything wrong with the shoes just my body does like the curved bottom. Any chance I can return them? Or exchange them?
review.name: Don’t like

review.reviewBody: I bought both the WK400 austern(blue) and steel grey and rotated them daily since 1/1/24. I just crossed over 2500+ miles between the two. So roughly 1250 miles for each pair. I was just starting to have very slight discomfort from excessive wear. I consider that to be amazing. I just rotated in two new pairs of WK400 this morning. All of my walking has been paved road walking with minimal dirt trail. I am extremely pleased with their longevity. I referred 3 people who are now experiencing similar results with rotating between 2 sets of the WK400. I would not hesitate one bit to give Keen WK400 a real look and test. They exceeded all my dreams. Keep stepping Keen Family!!!
review.name: Wk400 The shoe that keeps on going!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The WK400 is an interesting product that I hope doesn't get phased out because of wanting a newer product or look...sales vs design, or letting the urge for "out with the old, in with the new" to take too strong of a hold. 

With an Achilles tendon problem in one leg, and a poor knee replacement in the other, the curve of this shoe forces a more natural gait while walking. I now own 5 different pairs of the WK400. The more subtle curve on the WK450 is slightly less effective for my particular problem. But I am glad I bought them...experimentation might be the key. I do understand that design usually has a more average range of problems in mind.

If my feet hadn't expanded a half size with the toll and natural consequences of age, the older Keen shoes bought at least 15 years ago...that are still in my closet...would still be in service. Inserts are the only thing I've needed to replace on all of them over the years. For a while another company who "specializes" in non-prescription orthopedic shoes attracted my attention. They are fine if one is not particularly active, and I don't know if Keen has put thought into it, but there is more side to side support then what I thought, in a starry eyed moment, might be a replacement. 

The one pair of Keen waterproof/ insulated boots I own...and they seem to have disappeared from the lineup, though the Davenport looks the closest...sorta work by removing the inserts and wearing the thinnest socks possible to give added space, but that is a silly long term solution. When winter again approaches, I may need some suggestions on the closest model to the "walking curve" the WK400 or 450 have...or maybe that is a pipe dream. And despite the insulation, I should probably consider jumping up a size to accommodate heavier socks. Or should I consider going "wide". If these are common sense suggestions, I don't see them mentioned.
review.name: It could be sub-classified in a medical category

review.reviewBody: I have a love / hate relationship with these shoes. When walking on smooth surfaces, this shoe makes you feel like you are going Mach 1, on uneven surfaces, they are an ankle twister. Twisted my ankle 3 times, have not done that for 10 years.
review.name: Smooth surface great, others, be careful.

review.reviewBody:
I have bought 3 pairs of these shoes because I love the way they feel and support my feet. Walking with these is the best! thank you for such a great shoe!
Patrick
review.name: I have bought 3 pairs

name: WK400 Walking Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Epix Pro Gen 2 Sapphire Sport Watch
review.reviewBody:
This was my first smart watch and I am very impressed with the abilities. I got this mainly for cycling, hiking, and just doing things around. I use Garmin products on my bike and wanted something that would integrate with my sensors, but something I could take hiking. 

Originally I was looking at Garmin Edge 1050, but it did not play well with being off the bike, so I started looking at watches. The Pheonix 8 did not have great reviews and seen the Epix 2 Pro and how people really liked the product, and I can see why. 

The Epix Pro 2 51mm is amazing on the data it can collect and I love the clarity of the watch face. 

The only issue is with the band, it is soft, but does not feel well on the hand.
review.name: Fantastic First Garmin Watch

review.itemreviewed: Epix Pro Gen 2 Sapphire Sport Watch
review.reviewBody:
The 454 pixel resolution along with the largest size and color display is the most important feature to me - I can see all the terrific data the epix is providing.  Also, the larger battery is more useful to me than the mostly unused by me solar charging feature of my previous Garmin.  
I am very satisfied after going up to this level of a Garmin.
review.name: The ‘epix Pro (Gen 2) Saphire 51 mm’ is Epic

review.itemreviewed: Epix Pro Gen 2 Sapphire Sport Watch
review.reviewBody: Three weeks in and this watch is insane!! Every possible metric you can measure WITH ACCURACY
review.name: Epix

review.itemreviewed: Epix Pro Gen 2 Sapphire Sport Watch

review.name: Mind blowing tech!

review.reviewBody: In a recent bike accident, I hit my head on a inmovable object going 18mph. While I suffered other injuries to my body, my Eclipse Spherical helmet did its job well in protecting me from serious head injuries. The helmet’s unique spherical design helped cushion the impact of the crash and saved me from serious head and neck injury. Don’t mince when considering protection for your head. I’m so fortunate in buying this helmet!
review.name: This Helmet Saved Me in a Crash!

review.reviewBody: I had a crash this weekend in a race. My head whiplashed back onto the road pavement. This helmet did its job. No concussion, just a slight head. Thank you! No ER visit necessary.
review.name: This helmet saved my head this weekend

review.reviewBody: With some other top line helmets I cannot get a fit that keeps the helmet stable when I am down in the drops.  This helmet is perfect in terms of stability and comfort.  Additionally, independent reviewers rate it very highly for safety and aerodynamics.  Plus its blue color is a perfect match for my blue Trek bike!
review.name: Great fit; when others failed miserably

review.reviewBody: Best helmet I've used in over 40 years of cycling!  It's aerodynamic, producing minimal wind noise while cruising at 22mph.  The fit is excellent and required minimal set up.  I like that it can be adjusted mid ride with a simple rotation of a thumb wheel at the back of the helmet.  The helmet straps don't buffet in cross winds/head winds which minimizes noise as well.  All in all it is super comfortable in a broad range of temperature ranges.  I live in north east Florida and have used it in temperature ranges of 95+ with high humidity and temperatures down to the high 20s without any discomfort.
review.name: Excellent helmet

name: Eclipse Spherical Helmet

hasVariant.description: Buy the NiteRider Lumina Micro 900 Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Nice and light but the runtime is more like 1 hour
review.name: Run time is more like 1 hour

review.reviewBody:
This light is well-made, compact, and the diffuser lens creates a nice beam, perfect for mountain biking. The power output is more than enough for regular trail riding, and proved ok also for relatively fast downhill sections. The mount doesn't really seem to lock on the handlebar, but it actually does its job, and the light does not move.
The one issue is runtime: in real-world conditions, expect around 1hr 20min at max power, definitely not 2hrs as advertised.
I spare you the details, but after speaking with NiteRider Support I was able to reach exactly 2hrs on a bench test, with a large PC fan pointed straight at the lens. I can only guess that the Micro 900 has an overheating problem at MTB speeds, and that ultimately affects the battery life. Unfortunately, I bought the light for actual riding, not for lab testing, hence the 3-star rating.
It's also worth noting that one of the two lights I bought was performing significantly worse than the other (about 20 min less), so I got it exchanged.
review.name: Actual runtime is far from advertised

name: Lumina Micro 900 Headlight

review.reviewBody: Purchased a couple years back, but have thankfully avoided most rough rain days at work… until now. During our latest “atmospheric river” in Vancouver these held up extremely well. Water beads off, zippers kept up their end of the bargain. I really enjoy how light these are. They’re not the crunchy/loud ones from the bird skeleton brand, though maybe not as robust they’re absolutely doing the job. Maybe my only critique would be the waist drawstring, that could be a little tougher. True to size but of course since they’re likely going over pants, you may want to size up. 10/10.
review.name: Light and quiet

name: High Coast Hydratic Trousers - Men's

description: Buy the Neversecond C30 Ice Gel - 8-Pack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: C30 Ice Gel - 8-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Neversecond C30 Ice Gel - 8-Pack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I first had these at a Broken Arrow Sky Race training run. I am not sure why I have not seen these before, but they are a game changer. 
Sometimes choking down a gel is hard during a run but these are cold and like a slushie and not thick. I held the first gulp in my mouth for a minute just to help cool me down. The rest of the 'gel' went down easy. I even grabbed an extra pack and shoved it down my sports bra to keep me cool. 
BTW, they also go well as a trail- side mouth margarita. 
The only issue was with opening the package. Had to use teeth.
review.name: Like a salty citrus Otter Pop

name: C30 Ice Gel - 8-Pack

review.reviewBody:
I have bought a myriad gear items on Backcountry and Steep&Cheep, and they were always sized properly until now. Size 34, or L, fits me across a number of different types and brands of pants bought here, including snowboarding pants, trekking pants, climbing jeans, rain pants, etc.

However, these Icebreaker branded pants are sized ridiculously small, both in the hips width and inseam length. Icebreaker pants size 34 might fit my thin thirteen year old daughter, but she doesn't like the style, as the extra loose fabric around the knees make the pants appear frumpy.
review.name: Sized way too small

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Mission Rover 60L Plus Duffle online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love the bag. Great size and easy to travel with. However, there are a bit too much compartments for the size. With my use, few of the pouches will never get used before the bag getting full. Besides that, great quality and durable looking bag.
review.name: Great bag for traveling

review.reviewBody: Bought to use for multi-day buisness trips. 45L bag was advertised as largest carry on size and it fits perfectly in overhead bins when loaded out. It’s a tight fit in the smaller jets like the CRJ but it works.
review.name: 45L Mission Rover

review.reviewBody: Please make the laptop compartment out of some other material, spandex or whatever yoga pants are made of. I got the bag for buissness and travel needs and although I love the compartments I still need to bring another bag for the office gear. Please Fix.
review.name: Laptop doesn't fit in the pocket designed for it

review.reviewBody: Old travel backpack was actually falling apart at the seams after decades of service as a carry on and as an improvised backpacking pack. To upgrade the backpacking and hauling I decided to go with Mystery Ranch because...... well they're Mystery Ranch. We have been using them so long for their tremendous packs that some of them even say Dana Designs. After some research I landed on the Rover so it would be the right size, After one week long trip, I couldn't be happier. The Zoid cubes fit perfectly, and I have never been more organized. I love everything about the bag! OK I would have preferred the brown color, but it was sold out because everyone else felt the same way.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for travel and it is a great pack loaded with good inside features.  It could use some external pockets/storage.
review.name: Great Travel Pack

review.reviewBody: Purchased these for our team travels and are super impressed with the quality, durability, versatility, and overall utility of this bag. Whether for business or pleasure, these bags are going to last!!!
review.name: Killer bag, swallows a ton of gear!

review.reviewBody: I got my Mission Rover about two weeks ago and have used it twice. The first trip was by car - I was gone for six days - the Mission Rover handled all of my clothes with no issue. The design allowed me to keep a second pair of shoes and even my dirty laundry separated from my clean clothes. The second trip was only for three days, and I went by aircraft. The Mission Rover fit in the overhead compartment without issue and held everything I needed. I couldn't be happier with the pack.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a high quality bag of the perfect size for a carry-on that would easily hold everything I needed for at least a week. This definitely delivered.I recently was on a week-long trip for the first time with the bag and it performed nicely. The material and zippers are of high quality. Paired with some packing cubes I was able to get everything I needed into this bag neatly along with two laptops and an extra set of shoe. Importantly, I was able to easily fit it into the overhead bin on the airplane. However, only addition I wish it had was compression straps so I could've reduced it's profile a bit more in the case it was one of the smaller airplanes with smaller overhead bins.
review.name: High quality Carry-on Bag Found!

review.reviewBody: Very thoughtful features and the perfect size for a weekend carry on bag.  Good quality as well.  This is my second one of these, with the other being the largest size.
review.name: Very nice weekend pack

review.reviewBody: Great internal layout for travel. Could use 1-2 exterior mesh pockets for water bottle etc.
review.name: Good pack

name: Mission Rover 60L Plus Duffle

review.reviewBody: This is my second R1 purchase. This is a must have if you are active in cold weather. Light weight, wicks sweat, and really keeps your warm even in the coldest conditions. On a recent ski trip it was 11 degrees with a stiff wind and I wore  Patagonia wool T shirt, the R1, a Nano puff and a shell and I was toasty all day. The Lagom Blue is a great color too. It is a little bit long for my 5'2" height but not a deal breaker.
review.name: warm and comfy.

review.reviewBody: I love the look of this pullover and the lightweight yet warm waffle knit vibe, but, wow, it smells awful! I’ve washed it 3 times and hung it outside for days and it still lingers. I really hope it fades bc it gives me a headache. I ordered a Small which is my normal Patagonia size and it’s roomy.
review.name: Smells!

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned different brands of fleece pullovers, but this is my new favorite. I generally wear a small size, so that is what I ordered. I was concerned because many of the reviews said it runs small. Well, it fits perfectly with room to spare. I’m 5’4” and 120 Lbs. This fleece is soft and comfy on the inside and smooth on the outside. I definitely recommend this fleece, love it!
review.name: R1 Fleece Pullover - white - PERFECT FIT

review.reviewBody: I love Patagonia and have lots of their coats and tops put to the test over years. However this top compared to 2 older R1 fleece is cheap. The outside is scratchy feeling like you get in cheaper poly, and I see full on daylight coming through the waffle prints on the reverse. I presume the zipper would tear at the base where it’s sewn and pulled on regularly - with this thinner fabric- as often is the case with wear. The fit through shoulders and bust is tighter than my old ones (same size). And holding them up together the length is a good few inches longer so it sits below hip which is a bit weird for athletic clothing. Navy and this top are a sure fire winner so I’m shocked to be sending this back- but the quality is way off for $140 no matter the retailer. I’m sorry Patagonia. My other 2 are much better quality despite being 13 years old. Almost wonder if this is a “factory 2nd”. Disappointing. Took pics of new vs 13-yr-old waffle thickness held to light and tried to load 2 ways, but BC app isn’t uploading it appears.
review.name: Quality Dived, and Fit Changed

review.reviewBody: Had an r1 hoodie for years and loved it. Decided to get a new one in a better color. These layers are lightweight and so so warm. I love them for running. The deep zip front allows for great ventilation when I get a little hot. I wish this had thumbholes. I am usually a small in tops, but got a medium and glad I did bc this layer is very fitted, even sized up. I can only wear very thin layer underneath (like a Capilene top)   I love that it runs a little long so you don’t feel like you’re pulling it down for coverage all the time.
review.name: Love the r1! Warm and comfy

review.reviewBody: Our Met Golf team decided on this piece in teal for the 2023 season. 4 of us tried it on and we were all disappointed. We did not like the feel of the material, it was too long in the torso and sleeves and the overall fit was not flattering. The jacket in the teal has a much better fit but our players did not like the black pocket on the chest. Our taller golfer had picked the item out and was satisfied w the item.
review.name: So disappointing

review.reviewBody:
This fleece is AMAZING. I am shocked at how warm I felt when I wore it by itself outside in 10-15 degrees F. I was able to keep wearing it inside my apt building which runs hot (78 degrees) and I was still comfortable. I am very impressed with the comfort of this fleece in varying temps and how warm it is for the weight.

I've used it hiking and backpacking so far in ~10F as my only midlayer and it kept me perfectly toasty without overheating which is super important for me.

It is super soft inside which feels nice on the skin. I would say it runs standard in sizing, but the L was kind of long which I don't mind because its perfect for tucking into snowpants while layering. I usually am between a M & L, I want to try a M for my next one.

I would 10000% recommend this fleece and I already have plans of getting another!
review.name: My new staple I never knew I needed

review.reviewBody:
I live in Colorado and go skiing most weekends. This has been an awesome mid layer for chilly days. I wear a base layer long sleeve, this jacket, and then my Arc?Teryx shell. Warm even in 20 degrees.

I?m 5?4? 135 lbs and small fits great
review.name: Best mid layer for skiing!

review.reviewBody: I have several R1s myself, and decided to get one for my Wife and one for my Sister in Law as Christmas presents.  These are perfect midlayers, with something thin underneath and perhaps a down jacket on top. The warmth to weight ratio is exceptional. The high collar on these garments makes them functionally perfect for keeping your neck warm outside.  Finally, the beautiful colors make a great fashion statement.  If you like Purple, this is the year to pounce!  Purple becomes a Patagonia "collector's item" in future years, due to its rarety.
review.name: Two For Christmas

review.itemreviewed: Windstopper Base Layer Sleeveless Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody:
This is a really thoughtful and workable design.  You are hot & sweaty from climbing uphill and now you are whizzing down the other side.  The front windstopper fabric prevents you from chilling out, while the mesh back let your body cool during the climb.  It fits tight, as it should to wick, but it gives so it is not confining.   A great product.  I wish I could afford more of them.

I am 5' 7" and weigh 140lbs (fairly muscular).  I wear a size Med.
review.name: Fabulously engineered product

review.itemreviewed: Windstopper Base Layer Sleeveless Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Very high quality. I am 5'5", 132 lb and ordered M. It was tight on me and I do not like shirts so fitted to my body. The back is elastic and gives, it is not constraint. The front is very well insulated, the back is see through mesh and ventilated. Looks very good.
I will return it though because of the fit
review.name: A bit too tight

name: Windstopper Base Layer Sleeveless Shirt - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought these because I loved the color, but they are SO STIFF!  Very thick material, but definitely not conducive to comfort and every day wear.  I wanted to love these, but returned them. :(
review.name: Stiff and unflattering

review.reviewBody: Love these as a sturdy, thick work pant. Too hot for summer, but good for the other 3 seasons. Runs big through the hips and waist - suggest down sizing. Not form fitting, which is what I like for job sites!
review.name: Good work pant

review.reviewBody:
For me (5'7", 150 lbs), I ordered the size 10 based on my measurements. I was able to squeeze into these highwaisted pants and actually zip them up, but would have been really uncomfortable actually doing anything besides standing around in them.
My take on these pants is that they threw "women's styling" at these pants, which makes them impractical. The pockets are TINY, barely able to fit my whole hand into them.  The zipper is the length of hipster pant zippers, even though they are high waisted pants, so you can only unzip them partially down your widest area!  
It's disappointing that a brand based on doing stuff can't even make pockets for hands to fit into!
review.name: "women's" pants fails again

review.reviewBody: These shoes are super comfortable, and fit great!  They've instantly become my light hikers and I also really like that they look so good I can wear them around town. The tread on these things is what impresses me most as they are super grippy on wet slippery rocks and offer great traction in all conditions.  Couldn't be happier with these shoes!
review.name: So comfy!

review.reviewBody:
To say I was not impressed with these shoes would be an understatement. While these are definitely Oboz normal fit and potential comfort, with a comfortable and cushiony midsole, the lack of arch support in these is awful and not the norm I'm used to with Oboz. 

These are likely only suitable for people with very flat feet. If you have mid or high arches, you will be disappointed by the gap left in your arch and risk causing yourself foot problems, particularly if you have any sort of proclivity towards foot challenges like Plantar fasciitis. 

What's worse is these lack sufficient vertical interior volume to utilize even a thin aftermarket insole to provide necessary arch support, at least not without pushing your feet way too far into the shoe top for comfort. 

Oboz seriously needs to go back to the drawing board on this shoe, they're a major disappointment in general, but particularly for such an expensive shoe.
review.name: Not Oboz usual comfort and design

name: Katabatic Low Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: These shoes have been the best! They are easy to put on/take off, they don’t require socks (if you have a kiddo like mine on the spectrum) and that wide front toe space is helpful when he’s running. He loves these shoes! He’s a picky guy and he has asked to wear these all year round. Also - easily washable! Literally perfect!

review.reviewBody: Super easy to put on. Very good quality. Super light. And wide so kids feet don't get squeezed. Love it!

review.reviewBody:
My child loved the color and comfort.
The easy elastic lacing was easy to put on for school shoes. The grippy sole is great for physical education class. The stretchy mesh shoe material is great for flexible foot movement . The toe box could be a little more wider for better toe splay when active for a wider toe box that my daughter has. A challenge in finding narrow heal and wider toe splay footwear. 
I would definitely recommend to all ages who have a more narrow foot.

review.reviewBody: I've adopted nicer Castelli bibs for the road bike, but was still using Amazon-quality mountain bike bibs. I finally pulled the trigger on these and they are amazing! The mesh venting works great under a pair of shorts. Glad I finally made the switch. The sizing is the same across all Castelli shorts as well, so if you're familiar, no question on sizing.
review.name: Upgraded MTB experience

name: Unlimited DT Liner Bib Short - Women's

description: Buy the Saris Speed/Cadence Sensor online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Speed/Cadence Sensor
hasVariant.description: Buy the Saris Speed/Cadence Sensor online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought the fluid 3 bike trainer that came with the speed and cadence sensor so I could ride indoors when the weather is bad with the free version of a third party app. I could not get the sensor to work. I searched the web. I contacted Saris. I just could not understand how to get my avatar to move in the app. 
)n the Saris website, it just seemed to say download Rouvy and connect. I did not want to download Rouvy. So I thought let me share what I did so that maybe if someone else is as illiterate about this as I was, they won't have to struggle as much as I did.
First of all, download the app on your computer. It does not work on your phone.
Secondly, buy a USB ANT+ dongle for cycling.
Thirdly download the drivers for the dongle. Just search for that on the web.
Number four, open the device manager from the control panel, look for your dongle, click on it, and update the drivers.
Now open your cycling app, click on menu and sensors, and hopefully everything will connect, and your avatar will move.
I gave 3 stars because I think the sensor is good, but unfortunately I think the information on the Saris website is sorely lacking.
I truly hope customer service reads my review and updates their support section to include a detailed explanation of how to connect to third party apps along with driver downloads so that the next person who buys this product can just look on the Saris website and find all the information they need.
I really hope this review helps.
review.name: Needs better information on the Saris website

review.reviewBody: It was a great addition to my trainer.  And it was easy to set up.
review.name: Big Addition

review.reviewBody: The instructions say to place the battery inside the cab and then placed the cap and battery inside the sensor battery compartment. That is actually not the case. You have to put the battery in underneath the battery prong because the prongs inside the battery compartment don’t stick up high enough. Thank you have to take a screwdriver or something and bend the other crawl up high enough so that it makes contact with the cap. Then you can put the battery compartment cap on and it will connect if you did all that right. It should just work. He shouldn’t have to use a screwdriver to manipulate the battery compartment to work correctly. I wasted a lot of time and energy on this and I had a hard time figuring out how to get hold of support. It took them a few days to get back to me. Overall a frustrating experience. That being said, when is operational, the sensor works just fine.
review.name: The instructions are incorrect.

review.reviewBody: I'm mainly posting this review to save someone else a headache. I bought the Fluid2 Trainer with the Smart Sensor so I could check out some of the virtual ride apps. The sensor comes with a free trial of Rouvy. It took me 3 days and a call to Saris Customer Service (very helpful, by the way) to figure out that the Rouvy AR app only works when the sensor is in the Speed function. Customer Service guy said that if I wanted to get speed AND cadence at the same time I'd need to get a second sensor. I'm new to indoor trainers so speed only isn't a huge deal to me.
review.name: Cool gadget but only works for Speed OR Cadence

review.reviewBody: I just installed the speed sensor on my mountain bike hub.  It's a little hard to wrap the band round the hub, but not too bad.  Having a sensor makes indoor training tolerable; it lets me connect with online training apps.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: I'm new to bike trainer (Saris Fluid 2), and needed a sensor for the Zwift experience.  I've lost the sensor a couple of times, but not sure why or how.  In Zwift, it knocks the speed down when going up hills. I now wish I got a trainer with resistance control, so it will feel more like going up hills, and coasting downhill.
review.name: Pretty Nifty Gadget

name: Speed/Cadence Sensor

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely LOVE this cozy top. Purchased one a few months ago, and I loved it so much I bought another in a different color.  So warm, so comfy.  I may even get a third....
review.name: LOVE this cozy top!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this so much! It’s so soft and fits perfectly! True to size.
review.name: Great buy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This fleece is super soft and warm. The color is more purple than red, and it’s super shiny in the light. It also has great coverage in the stomach and bum area. The zipper seems like it’s good quality on the front and on the pockets too. The Columbia logo is made from leather, and so is the zipper pull on the front. My only dislike is how bulky the pockets seem on the midsection, but that’s a minor complaint. This is office appropriate with black pants and I may purchase in another color too.
review.name: Overall a Great Fleece!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits a little snug but very comfortable and cozy. Good purchase but size up if you need to.
review.name: A little snug

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality. I'm 4'11, skinny, but XS fits well and very flattering. Dark navy is great for office wear. It's comfortable, excellent texture, appealing, and people like it
review.name: excellent texture

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super soft and comfortable! It washes up well. I ordered the XL since I like my jackets loose. Perfect size. Nice color. I highly recommend!
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I think this runs a little smaller than the zip-up version; I usually wear a S in all Columbia jackets but sized up to M in this one thinking it'd be comfortably oversized, but the shoulders barely fit me and it's not oversized at all. I would've been in trouble with my usual size! Perhaps because of that it feels like I don't get the same range of motion with my arms as I do with the full-zip version. Raglan sleeves might be good for the pullover. Outside of those notes, I love the fabric and it's quite warm and cozy. I like the shark color because it's not QUITE black so there's some contrast with my mostly black pants & leggings that I wear all winter.
review.name: Runs smaller than full-zip

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love how plush it feels and the color! Great for winter.
review.name: So soft

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the fabric and style. It seems to run a little small so size up if you’re looking for oversized.
review.name: Very comfy

review.reviewBody: I am a fan of carhartt but the leather on the gloves I bought completely disintegrated. I am disappointed and will think twice about buying similar products from carhartt.

review.name: Work gloves.

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Insulated Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been using these gloves for about 3 weeks now. I'm highly impressed by the way my hands stay warm even in temperatures of -15. These gloves are also great about keeping my hands dry. I work with frozen wood during the winter. These gloves are perfect for that! Great job Carhartt! These gloves have a sturdy outside layer and a comfortable inside layer. These gloves are like wearing 2 gloves at once. I'm thourly impressed. I was skeptical at first. But since I have using them, my fear and worry has been extinguished. Again, great job people of Carhartt. I will be a customer for life as long you keep up the good work!
review.name: highly impressed! I won't buy anything else for gloves.

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Insulated Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: These gloves are perfect for working on the ranch--they keep my hands warm so I can concentrate on the task at hand.
review.name: Warm and rugged

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Insulated Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love these gloves. Super warm and water proof. They do a great job keeping my hands warm and dry. I love the simple and sleek look of these gloves. I definitely recommend them if your outdoors for long periods of time in the winter.

review.name: Great fit, keeps my hands warm and dry

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Insulated Secure Cuff Glove - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Insulated Secure Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’m disappointed with these gloves. When I read Gore-tex I just assumed some level of water resistance… moved a sheet of ice and felt the moisture coming through the synthetic/leather fingertips… they may be windproof but they are a sponge to moisture… knuckle padding and the fit are the reason for the two star rating…otherwise I’d be zero.

review.reviewBody:
I love pull on type of pants and these are the best.  The material is of good quality and they keep their shape even while providing stretch. The waist band does not pinch, and there are plenty of pockets.

I bought these for travel, but now I wear them all the time.
review.name: These pants are amazing

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, easy to move around in. The beef I have is the difference in color between the site and what I received. I'm the photo on the site, it's a vibrant blue. I received gray pants. It's 2024, have your pants reflect appropriately on your website. It's not hard.
review.name: Overall good purchase
comment: We are so very sorry we shipped the incorrect color, we've emailed you to see if we can help resolve our error.

review.reviewBody: I am 5’4” 135lbs with thick thighs & some junk in the trunk and these pants fit like a dream. I literally have bought 5 pairs now!!
review.name: love Love  LOVE Them!! 😍

review.reviewBody: Really comfortable pants to be active in or just lounge. They fit really well and are flattering. Plenty of pockets. I like the higher waste, it sits where it should be and doesn’t ride down.  I’m 5’2” 115 and ordered a small.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody:
You know how, so often, pants with a trim fit are too tight across the front of your thighs? These pants are roomy and have decent pockets to boot.
I am not a climber but wanted pants for hiking/biking in the woods. 
I'm 5'1 and the soft waistband is high on me but comfy (extra good for biking). The rise is comfortable, and the length hits my ankles. The articulated knees hit a bit low, but of course that's to be expected. They are not so exaggerated as to look peculiar.
I wanted a relaxed fit & sized up to L for the aforementioned hips & thighs. Really nice pants, really great cut.
review.name: Fits my curves and Quads!

review.reviewBody: I've worn these pants at work and for climbing. The waistband is wide and soft with no pinching, and (bonus) very flattering with a cropped shirt. They are a durable fabric, which is great for rougher terrain. I have longer legs, and these sit well above the ankle, which is nice for climbing, but they can feel a little short if I'm wearing them for work because the cuffs will ride up to my calves.
review.name: nice color and comfortable waistband

review.reviewBody: i have like 30 pairs of pants and i did not expect to love these more than all the ones that are supposed to be for lounging or professional attire or whatever else. i don't even climb these days but they are the bomb.  I bought XS which shouldn't have fit at my size i think but does and fits wonderfully
review.name: utterly love these

review.reviewBody: I have worn these pants several times.  I work as a naturalist and love the tapering at the bottom of the pants which make it easy for putting socks over as tick prevention.  The pockets are very generous.  I knew looking at these pants that there would be no belt loop to attach keys but actually there are 2 small loops, one at each hip which you really can't see in photos.  I got the Fern Green and was super excited about the color because very few outdoor companies offer women's clothing in green.
review.name: Comfy, Stylish and Functional

review.reviewBody: These are my second pair of Kanab Pants and love them. They are super comfy to wear, and pocket space is spot on. They are super for all around, but I especially love them for camping and travel. Love the color options. Highly recommend.
review.name: Durable and comfy

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like these pants so much. The fabric is great and probably more breathable than the Nylon of the Summit Joggers I wear all the time. They felt comfortable....almost. But the pockets were below my stomach. The waist was a little too tight. Maybe this is better for climbing and sitting in harnesses--it just wasn't the casual look I was going for.
review.name: If only!!!

name: Kanab Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Garmin inReach Messenger online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: inReach Messenger
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin inReach Messenger online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Been trying to have friends check my course but it seems that only when I initiate it they get the message. Past inreach gave friends the ability at any time to check on me. Being able to talk to "support" has been impossible
review.name: Not friendly
comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the inReach Messenger. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this unit to help coordinate rescue of my parents from Western North Carolina after Hurricane Helene.  I was able to send and receive text messages over satellite in areas where there was no remaining cellular or internet service.  There were small delays in messaging due to satellite pass over times, but nothing excessive.  Overall this is a great piece of tech and made my journey much easier.
review.name: Works when nothing else does.
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month ago because my family spends a lot of time hunting camping and hiking in the mountains of Idaho where there is no phone service and it works great. It gives me a good peace of mind knowing I can get ahold of them (my grown son has one also) or if needed get emergency services.
review.name: Love it
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.reviewBody: I needed a device to be able to signal for help whether at my cabin or exploring the wilderness via hiking, truck, snowmobile, or ATV in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan.  Service for cell phones is spotty or non-existent. This device is perfect for my needs.
review.name: Exactly what I need for Michigan's Upper Peninsula
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.reviewBody: My husband treated me to a two week plus trip out west for our 25th anniversary. We hiked the Grand Canyon rim to rim then camped throughout many national park areas. A majority of those nights were dispersed camping with zero cell service. We needed the Garmin Messenger in the GC for check-ins to the kids/family/friends back home to let them know we were safe as well as when camping for the same purpose. Very thankful to have a reliable way to touch base with our loved ones (and check the weather as well when a storm rolled in while camping along a river).  Also thankful for the SARS insurance offered. My husband became pretty sick in the GC and while we didn’t need the search and rescue I was so glad to have the option had we needed it. Works will with their Garmin Messenger app and with my Garmin Forerunner 965.  Didn’t know how much we needed this device…it has brought loads of comfort! Garmin wins again!!
review.name: Didn’t know how much I’d love this…
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.reviewBody:
Works very well.  Lil slow at times, but overall Worked great.
Price lil high, but can cancel by month and use when needed.
review.name: Worked great
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Garmin In-Reach prior to my high Sierra deer hunt in D7. It worked flawlessly. The tracking feature let my loved ones know where and when I moved. The 150 texts are plenty for my five day trip. I think I used about 15 or 20 texts. Their added search and rescue insurance is a minimal expense for piece of mind.
review.name: Great deal for a excellent product
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.reviewBody: I had a problem with getting my device signed up. Garmin help was closed all Labor Day weekend and I headed into the bush early Tuesday.  Unable to use the inReach messenger on my wilderness trip.  Disappointing a company that prides itself on emergy response is closed on weekends and Holidays!
review.name: Frustrated
comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the inReach Messenger. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

review.reviewBody: Even though I have this paired to my phone, my wife was able to use it on her day off hiking in Montana's Mission Mountains.  She was able to message me several times and I was able to see her location with each message.  this is the only time we've used it since purchasing it last week.  Impressed so far.  Have some sort of an issue with the plan I signed up for though.  Supposed to have unlimited pre-set messages and 40 custom texts.  App says I'm down to 18 messages and there is now way 22 messages have went through this device.  Hoping to get this resolved with Garmin.
review.name: Works Great
comment: Thank you for your review.  For further assistance please contact us at Product.Support@garmin.com or visit our Support Center, https://support.garmin.com/en-US/.

review.reviewBody: I returned it and bought a mini2 thinking that I only had to use explore app. I found out different. Still have to use messenger app. All videos that I see demonstrating the app, don't match what I can find after downloading the Messenger app.
review.name: the device is nice, but the app. sucks and is near
comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the inReach Messenger. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

name: inReach Messenger

description: Buy the Marmot Superalloy Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Superalloy Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Superalloy Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have used this tent in rain, wind, warm temps, cool temps (25-30 degrees) and absolutely love it. The tent is super light weight for hiking and is able to fold up nice and tight to save room in your pack. Only CON are the silly pockets inside the tent which everyone complains about, but not a big deal to me as I store my small items elsewhere.
review.name: Love It!

review.reviewBody: Took it out for an overnighter and impressed I was. Easy setup quality product. Wife loves the festive color
review.name: Gimme shelter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great tent. My first tent I purchased for backpacking actually. Super lightweight and easy to put up but left a lot to be desired after initial usage. The main con of this tent are the interior pockets. Lord is it annoying to have such useless pockets where everything just slides out of. A good pro is it has kept me pretty well throughout below freezing and the peak hotness of the summer. I have issues already though of the mesh getting some holes in it. I’m very careful with this tent packing it up and putting it down so I’m unsure what the cause of that is. Overall it’s a good tent but if I were to pick again I probably would’ve bought something else in this range.
review.name: Good Tent with room for improvement

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how light and roomy the tent is. The 2 person SuperAlloy worked perfect for my 4day backpacking trip. It helped lighten my pack by 2 pounds, replacing my 4 pounds 2person tent. The structure has great headroom and kept me dry through a heavy downpour. Room inside tent for me and my pack. The vestibule was large  enough to stow my camp chair at night and protect it from the rain. The tent came with 7 light weight stakes. I added two additional stakes to stake out the fly, which is optional. My only thought is the interior pockets were angled horizontal and were not ideal.
review.name: Great light weight tent.

review.reviewBody: Nice light weight 2 person tent that's lighter than my one man tent. Good price ! I'm happy 😁
review.name: Super alloy 2 person tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So I have so many tents. I have a few ultralight ones. This one is my favorite so far. The material seems to be just a bit better than big Agnes ultralight tents. I have way more room than my flycreek 2 and double vestibule. Probably only need one, but it is a 2 person tent. Love the colors and the weight. I didn’t think marmot could pull it off, but I’m in love.
review.name: Better and bigger than my big agnes

review.reviewBody:
Nice and light. Pole broke in medium to heavy wind and punctured the fly.

Marmot warranty covered it and gave me a credit, which made me very happy.

Would use again but in favorable conditions.
review.name: Nice and light for light backpacking
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
 
We are very sorry to hear that you have experienced issues with the product. We are also very happy that you decided to contact our warranty department ang got the issue resolved. Have a wonderful day.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.name: Marmot Does Not Support Their Products
comment:
Dear John,

Thank you for taking the time to reach out to us and for providing us with your valuable feedback.

We are sorry to hear about the issues that you experienced with your product, and our service. At Marmot we're committed to making sure to turn your experience around to a rather delightful one, as we use all the feedback we get to continually improve everything we do.

We have reached out to you directly via email regarding your questions, so that we may assist you further and provide you with more alternatives on the matter.

Thank you,
Marmot Team

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] For our BSA (formerly Boy Scouts) backpacking trip to Philmont, New Mexico, I purchased this ultra light 2 person tent. Since our trip was over 30 miles of rugged and high adventure and with extreme weather, I did not expect this tent to last for the two of us. It almost rain everyday and this tent kept us dry, mainly due to the rain fly. Occasionally, the wind picked up but this tent did not collapse. I own other 4 season 2 person tents but they are 3 to 5 times heavier. This is because the fabric is similar to parachute material. I thought this was the best ultra light yet rugged tent for most weather conditions.
review.name: Ultra Light Backpacking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy to set up and light. Footprint fits perfectly
review.name: Very light, easy set up, roomy

name: Superalloy Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pants! Love them for hiking - the extra pockets work great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent fit and I really love the materials and colors
review.name: Perfect fit as always

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great Fit and Comfort.   Bought 3 colors.  Will order more soon!
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants have everything I wanted. They look great and can wear them out, but they move & stretch so they are comfortable to wear when you have some things to get done. Lots of pockets, including a hidden zipper pocket which I love. I do have short legs but even still they seem a little long - my only negative.
review.name: Pockets and comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Some quality issues, side pocket supposed to be on side of thigh but it was side of calf  won't be able to use that. The hem was not pressed or hemmed right, looks defective. Shipping was much slower than other businesses.
review.name: Quality issues
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve. Please reach out if you need further assistance.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have owned several pairs of ROC pants and have been pleased with them. I just bought two new pairs and was surprised to find that the phone pocket on the right leg sits below my knee (It's 12" below the hand pocket instead of the 7" of my old pair). So instead of just reaching down to pull out my phone, I actually have to stop and either pick up my leg or squat down to reach it. Hoping this is a flaw in this batch of pants, but they're two different colors, so maybe this just the new normal?
review.name: Awkward phone pocket
comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, we will be sure to pass this information to the appropriate teams for future improvement.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have worn these pants for 4 years and are the only ones i prefer. The fit is excellent and hold up to the daily use i out them through.
review.name: Best pants ever

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfy and good for work or play. Would definitely purchase again
review.name: Very satisfied

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These fit great and are comfortable. They look dressy and you can wear them with anything
review.name: Great, comfortable pants

description: Buy the Gregory 3D Hydro 3L Reservoir online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 3D Hydro 3L Reservoir
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory 3D Hydro 3L Reservoir online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect size and worked well. High quality item. Would buy again.
review.name: Good quality

review.reviewBody: Great design, easily removed from my backpack for filling and cleaning, superior to my Camelback that I have used in the past.
review.name: Ingenious reservoir

review.reviewBody:
First use for me of the Gregory hydration pack was a 4-day backpacking trip in the Grand Canyon. Big fan of this hydration pack. Quick disconnect made it easy to refill without having to remove items out of my pack (was using an Osprey Atmos 65 pack). Handle on the front of the hydration pack and the 3-D shape gives the pack excellent rigidity and makes it even easier to handle.

Only “issue” I had was using the Gregory hydration pack with an Osprey backpack. Hanging the hydration pack from the hydration hook within the Osprey back pack caused the  water tube from the hydration pack to fold slightly right before it exits the backpack. This didn’t restrict the flow of water but I decided not to use hydration hook in the Osprey backpack 3 out of the 4-days of my trip and didn’t have any problems with the Gregory hydration pack freely floating in the backpacks designated hydration sleeve.

All that said, I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a hydration pack.
review.name: Highly recommended hydration pack!

review.reviewBody:
This is far and away my favorite bladder. I bought a Gregory Nano 18 H20 just because of the bladder. It’s best feature are:
- detachable tube so you can refill the reservoir without having to reroute the tube
- wide mouth
- carrying handle
- flat back

It’s great for any use. Whichever pack I bring hiking or backpacking, I always use this bladder. 

Note: I bought a 3rd party magnetic clasp for when I use it with other packs.
review.name: Favorite bladder for any pack

review.reviewBody: This reservoir is perfect for any hike, cleaning couldn’t be any easier, I especially like the design of detachable hose and simple close valve to prevent leakage. Kudos to those who  designed something so simple but exceptionally practical!!
review.name: Kudos

review.reviewBody: Love the reservoir and it’s excellent fit in the pack. One issue - it was very difficult to get the water flowing through bite valve. After much massaging and working with it, the slit finally opened. Now it is awesome.
review.name: Bite valve opening should be open from the factory

review.reviewBody: I just used this fresh out of the box at Isle Royale National Park & after 27 years of backpacking, this reservoir was a game changer!!
review.name: Love this!

review.reviewBody: Perfect for a day on the trail. The handle makes filling up easy. Fits in my Gregory pack perfectly.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Good bladder - easy to fill and place within a Gregory pack. The bite valve doesn’t have as much give as others I have used but still works well.
review.name: Good bladder

review.reviewBody: The best 3L bladder on the market especially due to the superior screw top vs others with the annoying zip/slide style. This far exceeds the old Osprey type large awkward screw tops, and is replacing that on my hydration pack.
review.name: Best bargain & quality on the market

name: 3D Hydro 3L Reservoir

review.reviewBody: These mittens are very warm and comfortable. The only minor gripe I have with them is the cuff is too small/tight to fit around a thick insulated Carhartt jacket. It is the perfect size to use when skiing in a sweatshirt, but if it's warm enough to ski in a sweatshirt, it's too warm to use these mitts.
review.name: Very warm, does fit around thick insulated jacket cuff

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace an OR Meteor Mitt which I dropped down a vault toilet by accident while snowboarding at Vail (RIP), and after years of serving me well, I look at these as an upgrade. They are warm but I prefer the meteor mitts for a few reasons. 1.) The cuffs on these are much smaller making it tougher to pull over a jacket sleeve, not terrible but definitely not as easy, 2. this might be more of a sizing issue, but the palm material being leather vs synthetic seems much stretchier and tougher to undo my binding strap. 3. The meteor mitt has a fleece inner mitten which does a much better job at sweat-wicking. It is likely better to just get something a little less toasty like the meteor which still does a great job but won't sweat your hands out like a steam room. Overall, they are warm. I wore them on likely the coldest day riding of the season and my hands still sweat but they were toasty enough to offset that.
review.name: Warm, Water Proof, A bit Roomy

review.reviewBody: Gloves were true to size and fit very well. They will keep your hands warm in the frigid cold and are very comfortable. Great purchase.
review.name: Perfect fit and warmth!

review.reviewBody: Good design, good quality, water proof and warm. The gauntlets are generous and the leases are very functional.
review.name: Wonderful Mitt

review.reviewBody: These mitts work great. Was out in 10 degree temps and kept me perfectly warm. Product is very well built and should last a long time.
review.name: I would for sure recommend these mitts

review.reviewBody: I haven't had a chance to test them in a full day outside, or at a ski resort setting (where you sit still in a lift for ages). But I wore them while walking around in the -35 C weather this winter for up to 45 minutes at a time and was really pleasantly surprised at how warm my fingers stayed. I tend to get raynaud's-- and these mitts kept it away during that cold weather, but I think moving my body was essential as well. I also haven't tested the waterproofing really. Only downside is that the lining isn't removable, so if you got sweaty hands, it would be harder to dry them. I'm a 5'9 woman with proportionate hands, and the mediums are perfect-- a bit big and roomy, which is how I like my mitts. Enough space to add another thin lining or heat packs if needed.
review.name: Pretty pleased

review.reviewBody: Excellent Warmth and Waterproofness. OR provides an excellent product as well as is one of the few companies in todays world that will completely stand by their product. Thanks for your excellent customer service as well as excellent products you manufacture. The only con to the mitt is that the Sensor Technology doesn't work as well as I thought it would for the touch screen phones, but who needs a cell phone when having fun.
review.name: Carbide Sensor Mitts

review.reviewBody: I love these mittens! They are very comfortable and provide enough warmth for even the coldest of days. The leather is well placed and seems thick enough to prevent cuts from ski/board edges. The tethers are quality and adjustments are easy with the mits on (don't have to get cold hands to adjust to the perfect fit).
review.name: Cozy, Functional Ski Mits

review.reviewBody: These mittens have surpassed my expectations! I use them heavily at the resort and bring them on REALLY cold days in the backcountry. The included wrist loops are a huge lifesaver when performing tasks on the lift, in line, or on the slopes. I never have to worry about dropping my mittens. The cinch cord and tightening strap are both very easy to use, even with the mittens on. The dexterity is that of a good mitten, don't expect to be sending texts with these on. I suffer from chronically cold hands, but these have kept my hands warm below 10 degrees with plenty of wind. The goretex does its job and my hands stay super dry. Overall very pleased with these mittens and would recommend to everyone!
review.name: Warm and Features!

review.reviewBody: These are the warmest gloves I've ever owned. And they're not obnoxiously oversized like other gloves meant for low temps. The cuff that goes over the sleeve has been very helpful in closing the chilly gap between where the sleeve ends and normal gloves begin. They feel very well made and substantial without being cumbersome. I've used them for single digits to around 30 degrees and I haven't felt the cold come through. Great purchase!
review.name: Warmest gloves I own!

name: Carbide Sensor Mitten

review.reviewBody: Crank Rival 1x crank. I ended up returning it only because it was the frame I was building didn't support SRAM Yaw derailleurs but I was able to get an Ultegra FD to work with my SRAM Red 22 shifters. This crank was a backup but I really like the look and finish. I currently run a Rival 2x crank but would certainly run a Rival 1 on a future build.
review.name: Great Crank

review.reviewBody: Solid 1x crankset if you're not too crazy about weight savings, the narrow wide works as it should, and I have it paired to a 11-36 on a cyclocross bike for local road riding that has a bunch of climbs, and it's versatile enough so that I can slap some gravel tires on to ride the dirt around here too.
review.name: Great budget 1x crankset

review.reviewBody: Jacket is very amazing, was in very Tahoe snow for a couple days in a row and never noticed the water at all. Jacket is very wind and water proof. Just what I was looking for.
review.name: Men's GT Shell

review.reviewBody:
Came home to my one-year-old crying like a baby and this beautiful new jacket sitting at my front door. You better believe I immediately put that jacket on and picked up my crying child. I held him close to my chest so that I could watch the tears runoff like an impenetrable force, not allowing a single drop to make it through. 

Seriously though, everything about this jacket is great - the vents, pockets, the fit, the color, and the feel. I’m 5’11” 175lbs and the Large is perfect. Sure it’s slightly baggy but that’s the style. If you want something form fitting go with something else, but you’ll look like a dweeb. What matters is that it fits my shoulders and chest and when I stretch my arms out my sleeves don’t ride up. I haven’t tested it out with my helmet but from what I can tell, the hood has plenty of room. 

I went with the Red one since I wanted my kids to easily identify me on the slopes. Best color I’ve seen. It’s not dark red but also not pink or orange. It’s unique. This jacket makes a statement. Great job 686!
review.name: Made my wife want to renew her vows

review.reviewBody: Haven’t ridden in it yet but fits great looks great tons of cool pockets and features
review.name: Excited to try it out

review.reviewBody:
This jacket looks great on the mountain and off. 
Kept dry when out for several hours in rain, but wetted out halfway through a deep powder day. Hood works well with a helmet, but hood could be a bit bigger.
The hand-warmer inner cuffs are good, but can wick up water during heavy rain.
Pockets are good placement and size and insulated phone pocket is a definite plus!
I love that various features in the jacket (such as the "Glove Link" are in a contrasting colour and labelled so that you don't have to guess their uses. Note that the jacket is a lined shell, meaning that it provides more warmth than some other shells.
review.name: Dripped out

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit and love the color! Been waiting for a nice red jacket with the right features and this one definitely does the job.
review.name: 686 Gore-tex GT Jacket

review.reviewBody: Only got a few wears out of this because my season ended a but early but I liked it a lot.  The color is my favorite part but it kept me warm and dry.  The sleeves do feel a bit long but I think that's better than the alternative when it comes to skin wear.
review.name: Dig it.

review.reviewBody: Very confortable jacket with the correct number of pockets.it has a very good price for being a GORE -TEX jacket.
review.name: Nice GORE- TEX jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It will be better If there are one more inside pocket inside or outside of the jacket. There are just one big pocket now inside the jacket.
review.name: Storing area not enough

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] After performing imeccably for 10+ years, it was time to retire my old 686 jacket. I went back to 686 and bought their GT shell jacket. The "L" jacket fit perfectly, not baggy but no restriction of movement. The hood fits a helmet easily and I love the well thought out and feature laden design. Used once on typical NW day, 35 F with wet snow, I stayed totally dry. This shell is a winner!
review.name: 686 GTX GT Shell Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the quality and style of this jacket. Size is a bit on the smaller so if you’re layering, I’d go a size up. 6’1” 190 lb athletic build - needed to go from L to an XL
review.name: Looks & feels great

name: GT GORE-TEX Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I’ve been very satisfied with these polls on the couple of tours I have taken them on. The quick adjustment is very user-friendly and have not had any issues with them sliding on me. Very solid product.
review.name: Great Poles

review.itemreviewed: Compactor Split Wr - John Jackson Edition
review.reviewBody: Overall for this model and type of compactor pole they are great! I definitely use and abuse my gear in the extreme alpine environment and I would say my critique is the mechanism that collapses the poles is still subject to freeze and not work great… Other than that I love the length of the grips, the weight, and the overall feel. They fold up great and the mechanism that helps them fold is designed great and has exceptional stability.

review.itemreviewed: Compactor Split Wr - John Jackson Edition
review.reviewBody: Used multiple times now, absolutely amazing! Love how they fold up. I use the alpine whippet attachment. Came in clutch a few times! Life saver!
review.name: Best splitboard poles!

review.itemreviewed: Compactor Split Wr - John Jackson Edition
review.reviewBody: Nice and compact sometimes the bottom spin because of the way it is made but doesn't bother the movement.
review.name: Nice and compact

review.itemreviewed: Compactor Split Wr - John Jackson Edition
review.reviewBody: bought two sets of these poles for splitboarding. previously had 3pc poles and even broken down they wouldn't fit inside my pack. These break down nice and fit inside without issue. They take seconds to put together and adjust to the proper length. Perfect splitboarding poles.
review.name: fantastic poles

review.itemreviewed: Compactor Split Wr - John Jackson Edition
review.reviewBody: These poles fit in my pack, are very robust, and I love that I can attach a whippet/ the Philips head built in. Really reduces the clunkyness of my pack and makes everything more streamline.. 10/10 would recommend
review.name: Just what I was looking for

review.itemreviewed: Compactor Split Wr - John Jackson Edition
review.reviewBody: I was looking for some lightweight poles for splitboarding. They needed to fold down small to stuff in a backpack and these fit the bill perfectly. The main reason I got these poles is they work with the Black Diamond Whippet add-on. Looking forward to having a little bit more peace of mind when skinning up steeper mountains.
review.name: Lightweight high quality poles with lots of tech!

review.itemreviewed: Compactor Split Wr - John Jackson Edition
review.reviewBody: Best poles so far. Fold compactly, extended in a snap, almost as light as similar non-folding ones.
review.name: Best poles so far. Fold

description: Buy the MSR Thru-Hiker Mesh House 1 online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Thru-Hiker Mesh House 1
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Thru-Hiker Mesh House 1 online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Use the thru hiker 1 as a bug bivvy in the summer on hikes like the West Highland Way,use it with a cat cut tarp(silwing) it's about 700grams.
Use a goretex bivvy 1.5kg in the winter or a 4 season tent 3 kg.
Can't beat the thru hiker for weight as for bivvies there is always some condensation.
Also have a small single skin bivvy tent going to replace it with a Hubba,zoic or elixer when it eventually gets replaced.
review.name: Thru hiker

review.reviewBody: Phenomenal shelter. I use it for my dog and myself and I couldn’t be happier with it. The pitch is fairly easy but as expected you do need space to stake it down. I haven’t noticed really any condensation but I do have my wing tarp fairly wide to help with the air flow. Not the best for really stormy weather, but I’d you stake it down correctly, it withstood a 25 M/H wind storm on a ridge at 7000 feet.
review.name: Solid shelter for fast and light packing

review.reviewBody: Unless your good at origami you may want a compression sack to go along with it.
review.name: One draw back

review.reviewBody: Was excited to see MSR make an offering in the bug bivy department and eagerly bought this intending to use it for both work trips and fun trips to replace an older (and heavier) bug bivy. Unfortunately, I experienced the same condensation issues in the foot box as the other reviewers (in moderately humid conditions with overnight lows in the 60s). The condensation was bad enough that I had to hang my sleeping bag out to dry in camp after each night. MSR normally makes great products but this one needed a bit more time in the R&D department before it was placed on the market. If they made a version of the Thru-Hiker 1 that used the same design as the Thru-Hiker 2 and 3, with two overhead points of attachment so no fabric rested against any part of your body (increasing ventilation and cutting down on condensation), it would be an instant purchase for me. But as it is, I can't really recommend this to anyone.
review.name: Condensation an issue in the foot box

review.reviewBody: I want to love this, like really love it, but I can't. And the reason is the footbox. I am not unfamiliar with single wall shelters, I own 4 different styles. Condensation is always going to happen in single wall shelters, it's part of the game. You can do various things to mitigate it but the issue with the Mesh House 1 is that you can't. When your inside the tent on a pad with your sleeping bag on, there is no way to not have the wall of the tent directly on your footbox. And in my experience, with no airflow at the foot end as well as the direct contact, you wake up with a wet bag, no matter what. I do like the design of the tent overall, but this issue makes me not love it. I would suggest if you are looking at a Mesh House, get the Mesh House 2.
review.name: I want to love it.........

review.reviewBody: Love it! It's so small and packable which is he best part about this tent. Very simple to set up. There isn't space to sit up inside but if you are just looking for a place to lay your head, it's a good little tent.
review.name: Good little tent

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love it, but overall, this will be a rarely used item in my quiver. For the weight difference, the Mesh House 2 is a better option for a solo hiker than the 1. Like other reviewers here I found that condensation in the foot of this shelter is a huge issue. I would use this in the desert in some seasons, but not again here in the Pacific NW. I also found it hard to sleep on my back in this shelter due to the fabric pressing on my toes. There is just not enough height for that IMO. I am 5' 8"" and changing clothes in the Mesh House 1 was a huge pain. I own the Thru-Hiker wing in the 70 size, and the Mesh House 2, which I will use regularly on solo missions. The Mesh House 1 was a good idea, but the overall width, tight toe box and weird fabric choice (not breathable) are fails here. Overall I am really digging the MSR minimalist shelters, however I agree with other reviewers that MSR is not giving us enough length on guylines, enough stakes to do a proper bad weather pitch, and also not providing guylines on all of the points they should for a full-on pitch. These are easy things to fix yourself, but should you have to? Kudos on including some spare seam sealant - but the implication is that this should be done before use - which needs to be clarified.
review.name: Not Quite Fully Baked

review.reviewBody: This tent would be great if you're taking it somewhere you know there is 0 chance of rainfall. Otherwise you need to add a tarp which adds weight and set up complexity. They tarp they suggest, or any other for that matter, increases your stake count from 5 to 10, and if you're in slightly rocky or rooty soil you may not be able to get them in at all the right places. What this tent needs is a form fitting rainfly that attaches to the existing 4 tent corner stakes and a vestibule with 1 more stake. If you're reading this MSR please make the fly I suggest, and I will be throwing my money at you!!
review.name: Good idea buts needs a rainfly

review.reviewBody: MSR has been providing quality products since they began and it is no different today. It is obvious that thought has gone into this tent. The reinforcements at the stress points is no more or less than needed and entry and exit are easy. The older I get the more difficult things become and I appriciate it when things just work; Getting harder to find these days.
review.name: I intend to buy another.

review.reviewBody: I've used this shelter for seven trips so far in two months. On the first four trips there was heavy condensation on the top panel in the leg/foot area, two of those times my down quilt was actually frozen to the tent fabric. This is Colorado, not Florida! So, I fixed the problem. I bought some 10D noseeum mesh (0.5 oz/square yard) and replaced some of the waterproof fabric at the foot end, leaving only a 12 inch strip of the original fabric at the bottom. This allows a 72 inch pad to be fully covered by mesh. See photographs. No more condensation or frost! There is still minor condensation on the vertical panel at the head end, but it doesn't drip and can be wiped easily. I've used the new thru hiker 70 wing twice with the shelter and just pitched the foot end lower to compensate. Another modification I had to make was to replace the supplied 6 foot top guyline with an 8 foot guyline because I barely had enough line to adjust the pole or to reach the ground. With round top poles I have to wrap the line around the handle to keep the line from slipping off the pole. Also, the pole tip needs to be planted at least 6 inches from the head edge to prevent bumping into it from the inside. The door is wonderfully wide and easy to get in and out. But the far end (the apex of the curve) is hard to reach. I would recommend reorienting the zipper to go from the top down the front seam and then curve along the bottom, with a tie on the top seam. This would allow the double separating zippers to be positioned near the head within easy reach to open vertically and horizontally. This is now my favorite summer bivy. At 10 ounces it's just 3 ounces heavier than the bivies that are barely off the face, but so much more convenient. In this one I can sit up almost fully, change tops and bottoms easily, unfold and read maps, all zipped up from the insects. So, as designed, I recommend use in warm and dry conditions only. But with the mesh modification, it is more versatile.
review.name: Go-to Summer Bivy

name: Thru-Hiker Mesh House 1

hasVariant.description: Buy the Topeak FrontLoader Handlebar Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is more or a bag 'system' than a handlebar bag.  The bag itself is a small dry bag like what you would take canoeing or kayaking.  It opens at both ends and has an air release valve so you can compress it down after it has been sealed.  So far, so good.   To attach this to your bike, you need to mount a flexible rubber sleeve to your handlebars/head tube and then clamp that *around* the bag.  Nothing secures the bag to the sleeve.  The problem is that if your bag is not full enough or the gear inside is not distributed across the whole length of the bag, the rubber sleeve doesn't clamp down securely enough to hold the dry bag in place when you're traversing rough roads.  On a recent trip, I had just a few items in the bag and on a rough descent, with the sleeve cinched as tightly as possible, the bag would come out or nearly come out on any rough descent.
review.name: Has some serious flaws
comment: It's a decent bag. The description says it is ideal for bulky and light items (i.e. sleeping bag, puffer jackets etc). If it's not full, make sure to cinch it well, no issues for me. My complaint though is the pamphlet with instructions, which are not clear at all and it took me way longer than it should to understand how to attach it to the handlebars. Once that's done, it's fine. It comes with silicone patches from 3M to protect the bike frame from being scratched. So if I switch bikes, how am I supposed to get more of those?

name: FrontLoader Handlebar Bag
