review.itemreviewed: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love Bogs boots! I've had several pairs for snow when I lived in Wisconsin. Now I am in New Orleans and needed rain boots (the Bogs snow boots are too insulated and warm for New Orleans!). These are the cutest, most comfy boots! I love wearing them in the garden and on rainy days. I always joke that if I was famous I would ask to be a spokesperson for Bogs. I could talk them up all day!
review.name: Cute and comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these for going out in the wet grass first thing in the AM. Im a size 7 and needed a 6.
review.name: Even my husband loved them!

review.itemreviewed: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable and airy enough for hot humid summer barn chores...12-16 hours of horse/farm/chore care might require a more substantial foot/heal support though for us aging horse women
review.name: Good for partial days of hot summer horse and farm work

review.itemreviewed: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I use these for the yard and bad weather. They are perfect. Very comfortable to walk around in and one feels very safe and secure from mud, rain, insects, or whatever. I love the sunny happy color and design. Easy to get on and off as well! No tugging! Love them!
review.name: Cute, functional, and comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the boots! They are a really soft, comfortable rubber. I put them on and wore them all day and I have very sensitive feet.
review.name: So Comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Cute n cozy! Wear all day and my feet do not hurt! Perfect for my greenhouse job. And I get lots of compliments. (Last year I bought a cheap brand and my feet hurt so bad!(
review.name: Thankful for the comfort!

review.itemreviewed: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very disappointed these are advertised as manufactured in the USA. They are not - All manufactured in China.
review.name: Made in China not USA

review.itemreviewed: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: After at least ten years, I had to replace my old Bogs garden boots which I wear almost every day in the summer, and often in the winter. After that length of time, I finally wore a hole in them! So, on to these super cute and comfortable Bogs ankle boots. The best feature is that I can step right into them. Taking them off is easy, too. I wear a size 8 and that's what I bought. I felt they ran a tiny bit large, so I switched the insole to the fleece type which definitely fit me better.
review.name: Great garden boots

review.itemreviewed: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these cute rain boots for my daughter and she loves them. ❤️ We live in the country and when it rains the ground gets really sloppy, but she wears them every time she goes outside to feed the dogs, gardening, mowing and so many other things because there is always something to do here. She said that they are light weight, comfortable, easy to slip off, protects from snakes and so very cute. We bought highly recommend buying them . I have also ordered her a pair of tall periwinkle boots. I am ordering her a pair of the "Rose Garden " low cut rain boots. You will love ❤️ these boots.
review.name: Great for country life

review.itemreviewed: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: As expected, without option of half sizes, the BOGS boots did not work for me-- was too small, 7 was too big. Regretfully returned both sizes.
review.name: Need half sizes!

name: Patch Ankle Cow Print Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love the Canada Goose Shelburne Parka. It’s incredibly warm and perfect for cold weather travel. The fit is just right—snug enough to keep the warmth in but still comfortable to move around in. It’ll be fantastic in snow and wind, which makes it ideal for winter adventures or even just daily wear in really cold climates. The high-quality materials feel durable and ready for harsh winter weather, and the extra length provides great coverage. Highly recommend it for anyone looking for serious warmth and comfort in freezing conditions!
Pros
Extremely warm and wind-resistant
Sleek design with a tailored fit
High-quality materials and construction
Ample storage pockets
Cons
Pricey, but you’re paying for a high-quality, long-lasting investment
Not packable, which limits its portability for travel
Slightly heavy, which may feel a bit cumbersome for mild winter days
review.name: serious warmth and comfort

name: Shelburne Parka - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Assosoires Long-Sleeve Skin Layer Superleger Top - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I use this Super-lightweight and the Assos summer LS base layer for Florida riding in the warm summer weather.  As with all Assos products, it is beautifully made and their materials seem to have 'magical' wicking properties.!!  When some of my bike colleagues are wringing with sweat, I am dry and comfy during the most intense efforts.  Most cyclists seem to think that base layers are for warmth.. not so; it's all about wicking, and the warmer the weather, the more you need this.  I think in their base layers is where the Assos R&D have really surpassed everyone, and it has been that way for over 2 decades that I have been using their products.

Sizing is accurate and the stretchy nature of the fabric makes sizing pretty forgiving, so it seems 2 or 3 size choices are all that are needed to fit anyone.   

Highly recommended !!   N.K.
review.name: Awesome base layer for heat // sun block

name: Assosoires Long-Sleeve Skin Layer Superleger Top - Men's

review.reviewBody: The two room design works as a changing area ,bathroom., and shower.
review.name: Works great, much better than what I had before..

review.reviewBody: My dad stole mine. For his land. And my boys can now shower in northern wisconsin during deer season and camping. I will have to buy a 2nd one for my rv now . We have had our first one since the pandemic an the price was better. But its still worth the investment
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I love the two rooms. One for drying off, even a place to hang your towel! place to put your soap and shampoo. Pops up quickly and easy to collapse back down. Well worth it!!
review.name: Love it!!!

review.reviewBody: Easy to set up and take down. Doesn’t take up much space, yet plenty of room inside.
review.name: Love it! Works great.

review.reviewBody: I also purchased the awning, a great add on with this tent it was awesome to use.

I recently purchased the Joolca Ensuite Double and took it out on its first adventure last weekend. I cannot speak to its longevity but so far everything seems really well made and thought out. There are tons of surprise features (laundry, soap, tp roll holders) throughout the Ensuite. It assembles really fast and feels pretty dang sturdy even before staking out the tie outs. So far I am really pleased and looking forward to the Got-2-Go that will accompany the Ensuite. Thanks Joolca.
review.name: Great Bit-o-Kit

review.reviewBody: Pops up easy and separate place to poop easily. 😄
review.name: Great tent well packaged and arrived in perfect conditioned.

review.reviewBody: Pooping in it right as we speak. It’s great!!! No shadows on the walls to upset the neighbors.
review.name: It’s great!

review.reviewBody: The set up and take down is a breeze. It easily fits back in the carrying case. Absolutely no complaints.
review.name: It’s perfect for us. We have a teardrop trailer and we use it as a toilet room and changing room.

review.reviewBody: Because we prefer something quick and easy with adequate space it just seemed right for us!
review.name: My wife did the research, we already had a bathroom tent, the Joolca looks to satisfy our current needs , we haven’t had a chance to use it yet but the time is near!

review.reviewBody: They are comfortable but could be just a little more wider.

review.reviewBody: They are very soft & comfortable. They are the best!
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: These slippers have barely lasted 5 months before looking ragged. I bought them as a gift in October 2023 and the shearling is worn out in multiple places as of March 2024. Ugg quality has gone downhill since 2010. I also had a terrible customer service experience with the purchase. Ugg's own payment system had issues charging my card after the item shipped. There were no problems with funds/anything else on my end that would prevent a charge. When I noticed that I hadn't been charged, I spent an hour of my own time proactively phoning their customer service to give them another payment method. Yet they still mistakenly sent me a collections notice anyway, which was just a kick in the teeth when I was the one who was honest enough to call about it in advance. Ugg also charged me approx $10 more than my original invoice (the amount somehow changed on the shipping and taxes) which I am guessing could have caused the problem with my credit card/bank. Despite all the payment issues they wouldn't honour the original invoice cost or give a shipping discount. So I would just avoid Ugg in general because you might not have a good experience with the store or the product.
review.name: Horrible quality

review.reviewBody: Bought these just on brand name when I needed to get new slippers considering I liked the winter boots I bough in the past. I like the quality and feel. I fits snug.
review.name: So far so good! Trusting the quality

review.reviewBody: I ordered one size larger (13) than I normally would have and it was still a little too tight on the top. I normally wear wide 12s and the width is fine and they're comfy overall. Hopefully they stretch out.
review.name: Too tight on the top

review.reviewBody: Well let me start by saying. This is the third pair of slippers purchase since early December. Two of the three had to go back. My husband wears a size 12 and both (different styles) that were sent back were at least a size and a half to large. So I sized down to a size 11 this time the third pair was a charm. My husband loves them. I recommend sizing down for slips ons.
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: Bought for husband. He loves them. Bought in chocolate too!
review.name: Husband loves!

review.reviewBody: These are beautiful, and exceedingly functional. No bending needed. My husband adores them.
review.name: These are great! And perfect to keep toes warm post surgery

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for my grand teens for Christmas. They raved about them so much I ordered a pair for myself. I love them. They are so comfortable and stylish. Even though my grandson loves his, his sister and I do too! Well made and comfortable too!
review.name: Perfect slip on!

review.reviewBody: The slippers fit true to size and are very comfortable. They look great!
review.name: My husband loved the slippers!

review.reviewBody: These are great! Very comfortable. Just wish there was a all black pair.
review.name: Yes!!! Get them!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love these shoes. Well made, functional, and stylish!
review.name: Functional and stylish

review.reviewBody: Bought each of my office staff Bogs winter boats as a Christmas gift. Everyone loves their boots! Easy to order, arrived promptly and when there was a size issue it was handle quickly and efficiently. Great experience!
review.name: Great experience! Great boot!

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. By far my favorite. I have had them for a while and the loop on the back broke, that is the only thing I don't like. Besides that, they are super comfy and warm. The traction is okay, I have not slipped wearing them.
review.name: Love love love

review.reviewBody: When I first got them I didn't care for them but now that I'm wearing them they are great
review.name: Yes I would buy again

review.reviewBody: Daily wearing. Extremely comfortable, warm and dependable. Love the side zipper! Easy on and off. I do a lot of walking every day. These boots are up for the challenge. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great daily boot!

review.reviewBody: Thanks to Covid, I'm walking as my primary means of exercise, and I didn't want to give that up when the Minnesota winters set in. Glad I bought these to extend my walking season. I've never had cold toes in these (which is a huge problem with my poor circulation), and these are good and grippy for when the trails are a bit icy. When I walk 5+ miles on hard surfaces, my feet ache pretty badly, but there was plenty of room for a cushioned insert, so we are back in business.
review.name: Best winter walking boots

review.reviewBody: Love these. Ordered an 8.5 which is my standard though in some boots/tennis shoes I go up to a 9. That's not necessary with these, they fit perfect even with wool medium weight hiking socks. I've worn them on cold rainy days so far and they were completely waterproof and warm with great traction. Have yet to test them in snow or below 35F, but I had no issues with cold feet so far. Probably won't wear them hiking in deep snow but they seem like they'd be great in snow up to lower shin. These are also so incredibly comfortable! I ran from a parking lot into an office easily and could definitely wear them all day. More comfortable than my Columbia and Sorel boots. I also like the style. Goes well with skinny pants/jeans or leggings if that's your thing. And the zipper is awesome, easy on and off. I'm just really satisfied and impressed with these! Definitely worth the price.
review.name: Best boot purchase in a long time

review.reviewBody: My last beloved pair of Bogs lasted me 20 years before developing a crack that made them no longer waterproof. I still wear them in the garden but it was time to invest in a new pair. I needed boots that could take me out on a cold muddy walk with the dogs and then into town-something practical and cute. These are perfect: warm, waterproof, sturdy, comfy and adorable. Love the zipper with lacing as the boots can adjust to accommodate my narrow foot very well. I find myself wearing these boots every day!
review.name: Just what I'd hoped for!

review.reviewBody: I love these. I put my orthotic inserts in them and wore them the day they arrived. They are so comfortable I didn't need to break them in. They are stylish and I can wear them with almost anything and they give me the support and warmth I need for my feet.
review.name: I would buy these again and again

review.reviewBody: Mountain hardware runs small for me when compared to other competitor brands, so I just about always order a size larger. True for this jacket. I bought one for myself and my daughter. She is an xs/s, ordered small for her. I am a medium/large and ordered a large.
review.name: Runs small side of size ranges, but fantastic coat

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer 2 Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: After years of wanting one of these expensive jackets, I finally bought one on sale. When it arrived I was surprised to find that it has no deep inner pockets like all the other down vests and jackets I’ve owned over the years, and no elastic cuffs to keep out the wind. The jacket is light, warm and fits well but the missing inner pockets would have been a deal breaker if I’d known in advance. This is a pocket I added.
review.name: Ghost Whisperer jacket

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer 2 Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have this same jacket from a few years ago. The sizing is a little smaller than it used to be. Enough so that I’d need to size up. Unfortunately, you cannot exchange…you have to return and repurchase. And the larger size is sold out now. So bummed because I love the jacket otherwise. It’s just a little too small to zip up just at the hips.
review.name: Runs small

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer 2 Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love it!
review.name: Super light weight, cozy warm

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer 2 Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Here are the things I don't like:  jacket material is a bit shiny; it's not really "fashionable"; hood doesn't fit particularly well, but glad to have the hood.  What do I love about this jacket?  It's so functional.  It's incredibly lightweight but WARM!  Great for travel!  I love that I can layer it when it's really cold out.  It blocks the wind.  It fits true to size and gives additional room for layering.  This is the best jacket purchase I have ever made.  Thank you Mountain Hardwear!
review.name: Five Star Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer 2 Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this coat!  Beautifully designed, well made, and fits me very well.  I will get a lot of use out of this jacket - hiking, walking, skiing.
review.name: wonderful winter coat

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer 2 Hooded Down Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer 2 Hooded Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Disappointed in the fit of these sunglasses. They hurt my ears and nose. I didn't expect the flames to be so big, either. Major let down and a waste of money, since I live in Canada and can't return them.

review.reviewBody: Awesome glasses. Super sturdy. Look cute. Customer service was AMAZING! The pink tint is really in your face, ONLY thing I’m not crazy about but willing to live with for more sun protection.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: The Shades are amazing!!! It feels like you’re wearing feathers because they are so comfortable and light. My eyes are super sensitive to the sun and these do not disappoint with the clarity.
review.name: The Shades are amazing!!! It

review.reviewBody: Due to a head injury, I have light sensitivity and these well made sunglasses keep my headaches at bay and let me still be stylish.
review.name: Due to a head injury,

review.reviewBody: These are nice, stylish glasses- that also have an excellent fit and stay on my face during any activity (a huge plus!). The shape is flattering. This is my first pair of 'fashion' glasses that are also high performers. Good coverage as well. 5-stars!
review.name: These are nice, stylish glasses-

review.reviewBody: The lens is great; clear, light and offers good protection. On the other hand, I expected the frame to be bigger and the plastic feels inexpensive.
review.name: The lens is great; clear,

review.reviewBody: Excellent daily wear. The mirror finish unfortunately shows every single trace of oil, so I keep a lens cloth at the ready.
review.name: Excellent daily wear

review.reviewBody: Overall, I really like the shape and fit. While large framed, they are flattering (not buggy looking). My only minor dislike is the weight. I cannot wear these for too long.
review.name: Great sunglasses!

review.reviewBody: My favorite sunglasses! Very clear and the color is so crisp. Perfect fit. I will certainly be purchasing more pairs in different styles!

hasVariant.name: Universal 4 Footprint
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Universal 4 Footprint online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased a Freelite 2 tent and then the Universal 2P footprint. I don’t mind not having grommets in the corners but why have an attached carry bag?!? It’s unnecessary and just adds weight. Does anyone ever actually use a footprint bag for a backpacking tent?!? If I cut it off will it impact the integrity of the footprint? How have others dealt with this issue? I expected better from MSR.
review.name: Not Up to MSR Standards

review.reviewBody: I am frustrated with this footpring (universal , regular, for hubba solo) as it has a very unpleasant odor. My entire appartments smalls from that. Can the manufacturer explain why? Also, the footprint is labeled “cancer and reproductive harm - p65Warnings.ca.gov”. Why? Is this (whatever Chemical) really needed for the function (risk benefit?). I also bought the hubba solo tent. It does hot carry that warning label.
review.name: unpleasant smell

review.reviewBody: how you meant to set it as just a footprint without metal inserts? Had a hubba bubba from 20 years back and that had them gromets.. also for bikepacking Hubba tent it seems a bit small.
review.name: not good

review.reviewBody: Great light weight footprint but MSR needs to do a video or PDF on how to fold it up to fit in the integrated bag.
review.name: Great light weight

review.reviewBody:
Useless footprint, no grommets to attach to the tent pole.
Useless pocket that can collect water.

This one was a total failure.
review.name: Useless

review.reviewBody:
As others have stated. 
 - No grommets for attaching to the poles: tying knots in paracord is hardly an acceptable workaround for a premium tent. 
 - Dimensions not perfectly tailored to specific tent sizes
 - Built-in pocket makes little sense. This is a minor issue in my opinion. Then again, having to resort to modifying your brand new tent with a pair of scissors just feels wrong.
I own a lot of MSR gear and for the first time seriously considered replacing original piece of kit with something from Aliexpress.
review.name: Sub standard. Expeted much better from MSR.

review.reviewBody: Echoing the other reviews - this is useless. MSR: bring back the matching footprints for each tent with grommets. We spend hundreds of dollars on a tent and are failed by an I'll decision on the footprint design. People will pay for a footprint to match their tent, so there's no way this is a loss of profit for you to cut corners and not have corresponding footprints. This is absolute garbage MSR.
review.name: Not universal

review.reviewBody: first, need to cut the pocket (why, you add this !). Second, I was decided to buy it to allow to build the tent under a rainfall keeping me dry. Unfortunately, I needed to find a solution with the small rope. It should be more useful with small ring to insert the tent pole . Third, 200 g for 2P floor. Please, review your article.
review.name: review

review.reviewBody:
MSR really missed the boat here, 1st - adding a pocket onto footprint to store the footprint, that is added weight, I cut mine off. I have always stored my footprint folded dirty end inside and then rolled with tent. 2nd, this leaving out the grommets and using string, garbage. I loved the old footprints and going fly with footprint was so easy, everything clicked right into the grommets and bingo bango all done.

Get rid of the generic footprints and bring back the old design, using grommets and no sewn in storage pocket.

I have searched to the ends of the internet looking for the holy grail, the Nubba Hubba 2 person original footprint. No such luck.
review.name: No real footprint - Generic Suck

review.reviewBody: To repeat, why no grommets???!!!..... I want to set up fast fly and poles only...( leaving the inner at home)....to use a lightweight bevy bag under...cant do that with this footprint....!!!
review.name: Annie UK

review.reviewBody: Fjallraven, stop improving!!! Your improved size was a bad idea. Fire the MBA who decided that sizes needed improving. I had purchased 14 pairs of pants from you in the past, recently I purchased two more pairs ... the size i used to buy - and still wear - is now too small now, the one size up is too big. Great going, you lost a customer who purchased from you exclusively!   I am disappointed, it was a smart decision.
review.name: Improved sizes, for who?

review.reviewBody: I wasn’t successful ordering the right size first time around, however return system works flawlessly. New pair has proven to be spot on, even more so in-use. Light, breathable and flexible.
review.name: Great pair of trousers!

review.reviewBody: Love these, own 3 pair now (different colors...).  Its like an everyday/everything pant for men.  For winter, I use the regular Keb pant daily, but for Spring/Summer/Fall the Agile is perfect.
review.name: Best pant ever

review.reviewBody:
I have had these trousers since 2023-05-08 and I have worn them for about 120 days. Let me tell you about how they ruined my opinion of all other trousers forever!

The problem with all other trousers is that they aren't stretchy like these, if you go back to standard material trousers after these, good luck, you're bottom half will feel like it's trapped in cage. Denim? Canvas? Work Pants? Nah, don't even bother trying to put those on again. 

Now, listen here feller, I live up in the rocky mountains of Colorado, I'm a walker, a hiker, a biker, a rock climber, a skier, a split boarder, a nordic skater, a paraglider a caver, a canyoneer, a tree climber, a farmer, and I go on several long expeditions a year. These trousers are GREAT for everything, EXCEPT skiing, boarding, caving, and wet canyons. I've sure beat the heck out of them, and they are still functioning. I prefer wearing them on days when I'm required to be in the concrete jungle as well. 

I'm knocking a star for two reasons:
1. They don't have a rear belt loop aligned with where your spine is. That means if you prefer suspenders and are used to wearing a Y back, yer gonna have to get creative or buy new suspenders.

2. The cuffs have two button placements and are fixed. This really sucks, I wish they made them like the bottoms of the normal Keb Trousers, where there's a strip of g100 inside a hollow at the bottom with 3 different buttons. Which you can cinch all the way out and button up so they stay at the ankle. Instead, when I'm wearing climbing shoes I have to roll up the cuffs, definitely annoying.
review.name: Game-Changing Trouser for Active Adventurers

review.reviewBody: I own 4 pairs of the Keb and one pair of the Keb Agile Winter and they all fit perfectly with some room in the waist. Ordered the same size for these (EU 46) and I can barely get them closed at the waist. Very disappointed.
review.name: Sizing is WAY off.

review.reviewBody:
Bought 1 day ago, worn once and the knee has a hole in it already, in the G-1000 knee patch! 

Was working with a  mountain rescue team capturing content. Most of the journey was in a vehicle so the actual 
walking distance was only 4KM so very little use. 

Kneeled down a couple of times to get some shots, terrain was rounded rock with vegetation of heather etc. 

On way back one of the team pointed out the hole, saying he has a a similar pair that are years old and still going strong.

Will return to store and see what happens!
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody: Perfect do it all pants for warm weather and shoulder season. can wear these to work and go directly to the climbing gym, on a hike, out to dinner, etc. Perfect blend of breathability, flexibility, durability, and overall utility. So good.
review.name: Everyday go to

review.reviewBody: These pants are amazing.  Very comfortable, easily packable, they look great.  They are extremely comfortable to walk in due to the combination of stretch material.  Can’t imagine a better design than this.  I haven’t had any zipper issues as I’ve seen others mentioning.  I can only imagine that they are trying to keep the weight down with lighter zipper material.  I’ll be purchasing another pair of these for sure.
review.name: Best pants I’ve ever worn.

review.reviewBody: I have the Vidda Pro and Abisko shorts for my hiking.  However, these Keb Agile trousers fit tightly at the waist with no give.  I tried the next size up, but it was too wide.  Added stretch to the waist may help with better fit.
review.name: Sizing discrepancy

review.reviewBody:
I thought my Vidda Pro's were the best trousers I had...until I picked up a pair of Keb Agile's in the sale. Hands (or legs) down the best trekking and general wear trousers I have ever bought in 35 plus years of trekking and hiking around the globe. 

Their first proper test was a hike and snowmobile up Langjokull glacier in Iceland and they performed brilliantly. 

The position of the thigh pockets is genius, and gives you easy access to items when sitting. The reinforced areas are perfect, especially the inner calf areas.

These are going to get a lot of use and I expect them to be as durable and hard wearing as all the many other bits of Fjallraven kit that I own.
review.name: Absolutely Perfect

name: Keb Agile Regular Trouser - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Exactly the two things I was hoping for. 
Water proof and light weight!

Great product, happy with purchase.
review.name: Light weight and water proof!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this anorak as a replacement for 20-year old beloved Patagucci anorak that was overdue for retirement. The medium stormline anorak fits great (5' 7', 158 lbs) I really like the waterproof zipper. I have been riding with this and it works great, have only been in light rain but no torrential downpours, so curious how it performs in those conditions.
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody: My son loves these jackets, he out grew his last one and just wanted the same thing. He walks home in the rain throughout the wet winter months, this jacket keeps nice and dry. Rolls up nice and small in his bag but gives big rain protection.
review.name: Bought it again!

review.reviewBody: Great and lightweight. It’s perfect for our summer florida storms. Still sweat a little but it’s better than the previous 10+ waterproof windbreaker type jackets I have tried and is a much nicer fit.
review.name: Love this

review.reviewBody: This is the jacket for "just in case" as its light weight and small enough to put in your hip sack or vest. And it's just fine if you're going for a run in a hard cold rain. It's better than the very lightweight "rain" jackets which just don't provide the protection if you had a helmet or a drenching rain / wind. The pockets are fine but don't put valuables in it as it may fall out if you are climbing.
review.name: Simple, Lightweight, Waterproof what more do you want

review.reviewBody:
I couldn't be happier with this anorak! It's truly the ultimate combination of waterproof, breathable, and windproof protection. Whether it's heavy rain, strong winds, or just unpredictable weather, this jacket has kept me dry and comfortable through it all.

The material is high-quality, lightweight, and durable. The design is also stylish. Overall, this is a fantastic investment for anyone who spends time outdoors. Highly recommend!
review.name: Perfect lightweight Anorak for All Weather Conditions!

review.reviewBody: I really love the fit, weight, and simplicity of this coat. Unfortunately my zipper isn't actually waterproof. Everytime I get caught in a real downpour water soaks through to my chest. The coat stays dry everywhere else. This coat good for a back up when you're not expecting rain. If the forecast looks grim I'll carry something more reliable.
review.name: Zipper Not Waterproof

review.reviewBody: Great jacket, not too hot and protects rain amazingly, stay dry!
review.name: Comfy and dry

review.reviewBody: Have work on numerous hikes now. Completely waterproof for my purposes, and able to compact into small backpack easily.
review.name: Excellent lightweight rain jacket

review.reviewBody: Fits great, Really lightweight, color is exactly as expected, fabric is comfortable, durable and high quality. Super happy with this purchase.
review.name: Love it!

name: Stormline Stretch Anorak - Men's

hasVariant.name: Tour 9L Lumbar Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountainsmith Tour 9L Lumbar Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Fit Note: I wear 30" - 32" waist pants and I have to cinch down the hip strap on this pack within 1/2" of its minimum size. If you're smaller than me this pack may not go small enough to ride correctly on your hips.

After rupturing a lumbar disc, many of my favorite activities are off the table. I can still hike though -- I just can't wear a backpack. This bag lets me go for long dayhikes without making my partner carry all the essentials and food, because the load is entirely on my hips. It's also great for bringing along toys, treats, and water when taking the dogs to the park. The volume is just enough -- with thoughtful packing -- to bring along the 10 essentials plus lunch and layers in fair weather. I like having nothing on my shoulders; my arms can move freely for scrambling and my center of gravity is low. It's cooler in warm weather but also warmer in cold weather because the insulation in my jacket isn't compressed across my shoulders. I like that I can spin it around my waist for quick access to contents, even while walking. Yet, it is a surprisingly stable. I would absolutely not run with this bag, but it's secure enough for hustling down scree or boulder-hopping. 

ORGANIZATION
The water bottle pockets are versatile - they fit a 32oz. nalgene, 24oz. hydroflask, or bike-type water bottle. I've never had a bottle pop out by accident, yet I can get them in and out while walking (with practice). Very few "normal" backpacks allow that! I like the oversized zipper pulls (gloves), the quick stash pocket is large enough to actually be usable (again, gloves!), and the bright inside lining is very helpful when hunting for small items. The dividers and zipper are well-placed; easy to access but if you're not using them, they don't get in the way. The hip pouches are also well-done; they're not so big as to rub inside my forearms when I walk, but hold enough to be valuable. I comfortably carry my phone, keys, dog-poo bags, and energy bar, and can get items in/out without fussing. The left-side stretchy mesh pocket fits a range of object sizes and shapes and prevents them from bouncing. It's best for phone-shaped items, though. My iPhone 13 goes in and out with one hand.

STRAPS
There are "delta straps" to snug the pack up against your back, plus top and bottom compression straps to keep it from bouncing when it's not full. All those extra straps stay out of the way pretty well, unlike some packs which seem to just be straps everywhere! Speaking of: the hip straps tuck away behind the padded panel, which keeps them from getting hung up in car doors or flopping around if you're carrying by the handles. This also means there is a "tunnel" behind the lumbar pad, so you can stuff something in there if you need more support.

CRITIQUES
This pack is solid on all major points, but there are a few details that could be better for me. I don't use the included shoulder strap nor the optional strapettes. It's cool that these options exist but the upper anchor points for them get in my way. The bottom anchors are nicely-hidden metal rings, but the top anchors are plastic side-release buckles on large webbing loops. They don't tuck away anywhere and tend to flop over the zipper opening when I spin the bag around to the front, which often makes re-zipping a hassle. I wish the top anchors were the same as the bottom ones: low-profile metal rings.
The double carry-straps get in my way. Obviously they are good to have, but I would prefer a low-profile handle that lies close to the body of the pack. These straps tend to flop into the main compartment and slow down access -- and there's two of them! Also, they make the bag look visually messy, and honestly a little bit cheap since they are just simple webbing loops.
The hip straps have very long tails. This is unavoidable because of the forward-pull adjustment arrangement (which I like very much), but I wish there were some integrated way to manage all that extra slack while wearing the bag. Like if it could be tucked behind a flap or strap somewhere. I usually cram them into my lumbar area but they tend to work their way out.
The bottom compression straps were a bit disappointing for me. I was hoping to use them for lashing a jacket to the outside of the bag -- the provided stuff-pouch is big, but can't fit a jacket if the rest of the bag is already full. Unfortunately the strap length is optimized for compression only; there's no extra to accommodate the bulk of a jacket. This avoids having long 'tails' slapping around all the time, which is good -- but I do wish there were some integrated way to strap on extras. If not the compression straps, then maybe a set of anchor points where I could attach my own straps, which I have plenty of.

This is a solid pack that solves a real problem, and is genuinely nicer to use than a small conventional backpack. I will definitely continue using it even after my back is strong enough to carry a load again, because it's so nice to carry!
review.name: Ruptured Disc solution

review.reviewBody: does not seat on the hip within adjustment, keeps slipping.
review.name: road trip

review.reviewBody: Traveling to Spain with new pack/easy access and no weight on shoulders
review.name: New pack/ learning curve

name: Tour 9L Lumbar Pack

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I've used these down socks snow camping and in backcountry huts. They are too light to wear walking around outside when camping but they are a great thermal layer in your sleeping bag. So light weight and packable.
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: Nice product, not overly warm. The sole is pretty thin (approx. 1/4" thick), very flexible and grippy. I'd prefer a thicker sole for sure. Main problem is the fit, I wear size 42 (9.5) and ordered the large as per chart (and I should have been in mid-range as per the chart) but one boot fits fine while the other one is too small. No similar issues with any other foot gears.
review.name: Yes

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 LTR WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: a fantastic all round outdoor shoe, especially good for travel. Good enough to wear out for dinner or for a bush walk
review.name: All round travel shoe

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 LTR WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice looking shoe,  think i might buy the olive green pair too.
review.name: Happy with purchase

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 LTR WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Took them up to Loon Mountain in Lincoln, New Hampshire -  Walked all day never an issue
review.name: White Mountains Love Moab Speed 2

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 LTR WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've always loved Merrell shoes and I do love the Moab Speed 2s I purchased and if I was to change anything it would be I should've ordered a half-size bigger, I ordered a 9.5 but should've gone for a size 10, they are a little tight but I think over time they will stretch. They don't cause discomfort unless I tie my shoes really tight so I avoid doing that. The only other thing is that the laces are too short I find.
review.name: Love Shoe, Laces Come up Short.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 LTR WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Shoe rubbed the skin off my toe after wearing for only 1 day.
review.name: Very disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 LTR WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have purchased Merrell hiking shoes and boots for years and have never been disappointed.  This is the first time I purchased this type of shoe and am extremely happy with the performance thus far.  They fit well are light weight and made with quality materials.  Time will tell how they perform overall.
review.name: Running on the trails!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 LTR WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: After a horrible experience with the migrating foam in the footbed of a previous leather-upper Merrell, this was a gamble... but so far it's been great. Incredible cushioning, great fit. A few unexplainable hard spots on the uppers noticeable only on steep side-hills. Now on to the desert sand.
review.name: Wonderful... so far.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 LTR WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are really great,  great cushioning,  great materials and a great look, but they are too narrow for my feet,  everything about them is premium.  Wish they came in a wide /extra wide other wise a great shoe
review.name: Moab speed 2 leather
comment: We value and appreciate your feedback.

name: Moab Speed 2 LTR WP Hiking Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Sender Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very comfy, prefer the nonadjustable leg loops to the adjustable ones. Wear indicators are a good idea, just a good sport climbing harness.
As expected for the Sender line this is a super lite harness. And as expected from Mammut the quality is top notch
review.name: Sender sends it

review.reviewBody: Amazing harness for all around climbing. I used it for ice, sport and trad and I've always been satisfied. Comfortable and lightweight, a good harness.
review.name: Great harness

review.reviewBody: Lightweight harness that keeps it comfortable. As always with Mammut, quality is excellent.

A super harness that is lightweight, with everything you need and none of the frills you don't. I've used it mainly sport climbing and it easily fits all of my draws on the gear loops. 

The single adjustable belt loop and elastic on the leg loops make the harness easy to put on/take off, and make for a comfortable experience. The provided storage bag is an awesome added bonus and the bright orange colour makes you easy to spot for all those cool climbing pics!
review.name: Super Sport Harness

review.reviewBody: Fantastic harness which holds to my hips really well. Used on several outdoor climbs and in the climbing gym on a weekly basis. Have zero faults with it so far. Took me some time to get used to the elastic but now that I am familiar with it compared to my old webbing only harness I really like it.
review.name: Works exactly as expected

review.reviewBody: Harness is super light and very comfortable. Previous harness was the 4 slide from Mammut, I didn't realize how bulky it was until I upgraded to this one. The chalk bag attachment is a little funky, if you use a biner to attach your chalk bag to the back of the harness, you'll need to find an alternate solution because it'll twist. Either a belt or the Mammut Crag Sender chalk bag work well.

This is a great sport climbing harness that has been super comfortable. I've had it for about a year and have spent many hours hanging in this thing. It is really comfortable, lightweight, and functional. Love the thick belay loop with the indicator warning feature. My only complaint about this is that the gear loops are a little floppy and don't stay cantilevered off the harness very well for easy access to draws and pro. Other than that, this is a great harness that I highly recommend.
review.name: Comfortable harness

review.reviewBody: This harness is my everyday favorite. Love the fit and the way the buckle slides tight with no hassle. The gear loops are  great and look like they'll last forever. The legs are comfortable and flexible. All around great harness for sport climbing.
review.name: Every feature you want in a harness!

review.reviewBody: This is the best and most comfortable harness I have ever owned. I especially love the attention to details such as the subtle shape in the gear loops to push the quickdraws forward. Also the wear indicator in the belay loop is nice. Its given me lots of soft catches and I will definitely buy again.
review.name: Super comfortable and high performance

name: Sender Harness

hasVariant.name: Future Stem Comp
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Future Stem Comp online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
First of all, the stem seems fine in construction. The problem is that it requires a specific version of Future Shock, and if you don't have that version, you have to get a shim to get this stem to match other Future Shock versions. 

The specific problem is that there is nothing in this page that tells you or shows you that you need a specific version of Future Shock or a specific sized and shaped shim. There are no pictures showing the shape of the stem where it attaches to the Future Shock, and there's nothing in the item description that describes the versions that this is compatible with, only that it is "Designed only for the Future Shocks". Also, Backcountry doesn't sell that shim either, you have to find it from another retailer. 

From what I can tell, this stem is compatible with Future Shock 2.0, but not the other versions. Specialized's own website and manuals are extremely vague on this point and I haven't found information that says that certain Future Shock versions match certain stems. 

So, I'm giving this 1 star for the extremely lousy information provided here and throughout Specialized's own website and manuals.

If you do decide to buy this, look for the SPECIALIZED FUTURE SHOCK 1.5 & 2.0 STEM SHIM (FLANGED VERSION). That will give you an idea of the shape of this stem and it'll cost you an additional $10 if you have a Future Shock that's round like mine. I've attached the photo that they should've included in the original product description.
review.name: This page is missing information

name: Future Stem Comp

description: Buy the Rab Aeon 20L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aeon 20L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rab Aeon 20L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is a pack that can go from the office to the crag and then out to a brewery– I have truly enjoyed my adventures with the Aeon 20L.

The Aeon’s compartments and pockets provide efficient organization--effortlessly accommodating essentials like snacks, water bottles, and extra layers. The pack also incorporates technical elements such as weather-resistant coatings and hide-away rain cover, reinforced stitching, and adjustable straps that provide optimal comfort and support.
review.name: Boulder, CO approved pack!

review.reviewBody: A bit disappointed with materials and internals and lack of pockets.. perhaps my fault picking the wrong backpack but I thought 20L was good enough..
review.name: A bit disappointed with materials

review.reviewBody: Used for 7 days day hiking 80 miles on SW Portuguese coast. Great lightweight backpack with good pockets for water bottles on both sides and for gear at the back. Walking stick stretchy clips didn’t seem to hold the sticks securely so I have added a webbing and clip fastening at the top. I would like quick stock store loops. Mesh at the back pulled when caught on one of my first hikes. I haven’t worked out how to adjust the size.
review.name: Used for 7 days day

review.reviewBody:
Looking at the design and the spec this is everything I want in a day pack for hill days, whether they are walking, running, climbing or scrambling. However, having spent a few days on the hill with it I’ve noticed so many little problems that all add up to a bag they is extremely annoying to use.

An example of this is the bottle pockets which quite short and narrow. This means if you have a wider bottle like a 1L nalgene it won’t sit in them deeply enough to not fall out every time you lean forward or sideways. This is exacerbated by the lower compression straps which sit low against the bottle, slip under it, and push the bottle up and out of the pocket.

Then their is the tapered shape of the main compartment, which looks great but causes all sorts of issues in reality, the size of the internal pocket, the way the back adjusts, which causes the Velcro to bunch up against the back panel, the waist strap which is way to big for me (I’m at the stops and not a skinny guy).

It’s like they built a great looking and well spec’d pack but never tested it, which pains me to write because I have tonnes of rab kit that I love.
review.name: I really wanted to like it…

name: Aeon 20L Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is perfect as a personal item as you can carry as a tote when using a carryon backpack such as Farpoint. Also great as a non bulky daypack for use on a trip once you arrive at your destination.
review.name: This bag is perfect as

review.reviewBody: The Osprey Daylite is a great and versatile pack. It's great as a day pack on a trail and doubles as a tote in town. I traveled with it recently as my carryon and it fits perfectly under airplane seats with room left for your feet. It is the most useful pack I own!
review.name: Versatile pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this pack. The entire reason I was drawn to it was the fact that it could be either a backpack or transform to a tote when needed. I absolutely love the amount of space it has and the seperate compartments as well as the front zipper pocket. I use it pretty much for everything: day trips, class, or just every day carrying things to and from somewhere. You won’t regret this one.
review.name: I love this pack. The

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this as a gift for my wife, to try and organize her travel and get away from constant rummaging around in a sack. The versatility is excellent, the compartmentalization makes sense and...most importantly for her, there are TWO water bottle sleeves which both fit a larger, longer receptacle securely. The luggage attachment was an added bonus, and after only one trip we already know this pack will be the newest travel staple in our rotation!
review.name: Bought this as a gift

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've been using my Daylite totepack for about two months now and it's working well for my needs (work bag for university teaching). Before, I was using a ~25L Pacsafe backpack that felt like too much bag for what I typically carry. I like the Daylite's streamlined appearance (other than dangling straps), robust enough backpack straps, sternum strap, long enough tote handles to carry on your shoulder, and zippered outer pocket. It's also pretty quick to convert between the backpack and tote setups.

I wish it had a bigger key attachment on a longer "leash." The little red one is on a very short strap, so you can't pull it out of the bag--you have to reach inside the bag to clip keys onto it. That's especially awkward since the clip itself is so small and the plastic doesn't seem very sturdy. As I switch back and forth between my home and office keys at least twice per day, that's not very convenient. Lastly, a keychain weighs down the divider between the laptop compartment and the rest of the bag, so it's difficult to reach into the main part of the bag when keys are attached. Secondly, the wave blue turned out to be significantly lighter than I was expecting based on the picture on the website.
review.name: I've been using my Daylite

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect size and straps are comfortable. It's a great everyday work totepack.
review.name: Perfect size and straps are

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the color and quality of this Tote Pack so much; I have carried it on two trips, and it suits me very well.
review.name: I love the color and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the design and it is quite sturdy but it is quite heavy by itself. I carried my computer when I travelled internationally. That added more weight and at the end of the day my shoulder hurt. The design of the straps needs to be improved??
review.name: I like the design and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely love this pack! Happy to find it in the Enjoy Outside pattern to match my duffle bag too. Excellent construction with lots of pockets and the flexibility with the straps makes the pack so versatile. Once again, Osprey doesn’t disappoint - great functional performance gear!!
review.name: Absolutely love this pack! Happy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pack. I use it for my daily commute. Comfortable, versatile and substantial. I doubt I'll need a new one soon, but when i do, I'll get another Osprey.
review.name: Great pack. I use it

review.reviewBody: My husband loves this sweater I got him for Christmas!
review.name: Great gift

review.reviewBody: There’s one thing you can say about the Swedish: they know how to stay warm. This sweater is both stylish and warm. Pair it with a turtleneck and jacket to get through anything Winter can throw at you. Worth the price, will last forever.
review.name: Swedish Quality

review.reviewBody: I got cuffs so baggy that they’re like wizard’s sleeves after just 1 day of wearing and briefly rolling up to the elbow. Otherwise very warm, comfortable and surprisingly wind resistant. The cuff elasticity issue is the worst I’ve ever experienced.
review.name: Warm and comfortable but poor elasticity

review.reviewBody: I have bought mine 2 years ago and I love it. Maybe a little bit too much, so I have used it on spring/autumn hikes as well. Guess I shouldn't have as the fabric started to tear in several places under the armpits, probably due to the extensive friction. Real shame, I really wanted to get some more use out of them. I will probably try to sew the holes up myself and I'm hoping based on my review the next version of wool sweaters will have some strengthened fabric or some kind of improvement. That being said, I will happily buy again.
review.name: Great, but not an activewear

review.reviewBody: Sweater is great at keeping me warm and is pretty soft for a wool sweater which I really appreciate.
review.name: Great Sweater

review.reviewBody:
When I bought this sweater I was really happy. The Ovik Knit looked like amazing! And it really is!
But, after 1 month I saw a hole under an elbow. I fixed it. After 8 months I noticed 3 holes on my chest! I don’t understand: I spent a lot of money to have a sweater that I was sure to endure. But it’s not so…. This is really depressing! The sweater is amazing but really breakable!!!!! I think that you can find better sweater on the market, also cheaper!
review.name: Beautiful, but breakable

review.reviewBody: This is a comfortable sweater and fits well.  6’1 size large.  My only complaint is that the reinforced elbow patches are positioned above my elbows.  I believe the area most prone to wear would be on and below the elbow, rather than above.  Not a big deal though.
review.name: Overall happy

review.reviewBody: I just love it, so comfortable so warm!. I love the design and everything it’s perfect!
review.name: Coolest sweater I’ve owned!

review.reviewBody: Great piece of clothing. Been wearing it practically everyday for long dog walks during cold days, very comfortable, keeps you warm without overheating. I have even foolishly been out for a long walk before reading the weather forecast and got caught in long rain and sleet shower. After shaking like my dogs, water drops “shakes” off the jumper and I surprisingly stayed dry !!  Expensive purchase but worth every penny
review.name: My most favourite jumper ever

review.reviewBody:
This is the best knitwear I've ever owned, yet. Comfortable, warms up and vent extra heat and sweat out just as fast. As a middle layer under a hardshell jacket, handles moving around in very cold weather very well.

A must have
review.name: Warm and cozy
